docs.abstract: President Trump forced out the attorney general and replaced him with a loyalist who will take charge of the special counsel inquiry on Russia’s election interference.

docs.abstract: As the deadline to avert a partial shutdown approaches, many lawmakers have been skipping votes since House Republicans were swept from power.

docs.abstract: House and Senate negotiators agreed “in principle” to provide $1.375 billion for physical barriers at the southwestern border, a deal that appears to be a victory for Democrats.

docs.abstract: The president plans to impose a 5 percent tariff on all imported goods from Mexico, a tax that would “gradually increase” until the flow of immigrants across the border stopped.
